text: Robert Marion "Young Bob" La Follette Jr. (February 6, 1895 â€“ February 24, 1953) was an American politician. He was a U.S. Senator from Wisconsin from 1925 to 1947. He was a son of U.S. Representative, U.S. Senator and Wisconsin Governor Robert M. La Follette Sr., and father of Wisconsin Attorney General Bronson La Follette. He was a co-founder of the Progressive Party. He lost to Joseph McCarthy in 1946. ==References== Category:1895 births Category:1953 deaths Category:Suicides by firearm in the United States Category:United States senators from Wisconsin Category:Politicians from Madison, Wisconsin Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Robert M. La Follette Jr.
